verifier.value

Class Value

  • java.lang.Object
    • verifier.value.Value
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DAGValue, Expression, Future, IntValue, Reduction, SetValue, TruthValue

    public abstract class Value
extends java.lang.Object
    An IValue represents an internal verifier value. These are values which can be represented in the rules language, and include integers, truth, falsity, sets, DAGs, closures (functions as values), expressions (these are arbitrary s-expressions), or suspensions.
    See Also:
    IntValue, TruthValue, SetValue, DAGValue, verifier.value.Closure, Expression, verifier.ISuspension

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public abstract Value execute(IValueVisitor visitor)
        Each concrete value class must implement this visitor hook method.
        Parameters:
        visitor - Execute this visitor on the target.
        Returns:
        This method will relay the return value of the visitor.

      • toASE

        public abstract ASExpression toASE()
        Convert this value to a serializable s-expression format.
        Returns:
        This method returns the s-expression format for the target value.

      • seal

        public void seal()
        Seal the value, denoting that no new information will ever arrive.

      • isSealed

        public boolean isSealed()
        Returns:
        This method returns true if the value has been sealed or false if it has not been.
